skill.name: agentdb-advanced-features
skill.description: Master advanced AgentDB features including QUIC synchronization, multi-database management, custom distance metrics, hybrid search, and distributed systems integration. Use when building distributed AI systems, multi-agent coordination, or advanced vector search applications.
skill.summary: Master advanced AgentDB features including QUIC synchronization, multi-database management, custom d...
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: This documentation skill for AgentDB advanced features was flagged with 137 potential issues, but all critical and high findings are false positives. The static scanner misinterpreted vector distance formulas (cosine, euclidean, dot product) as cryptographic algorithms and markdown code block backticks as shell execution. Legitimate concerns include example IP addresses shown in QUIC configuration documentation and the inherent network synchronization capabilities that require proper firewall configuration. The skill is documentation-only with no executable code and includes its own security best practices.

medium_findings.title: Network synchronization exposes internal IPs
medium_findings.description: Documentation shows hardcoded internal IP addresses (192.168.1.10-12) for QUIC synchronization peers. In production, this could expose internal network topology if not properly configured with firewall rules and authentication.

low_findings.title: Firewall configuration requires elevated privileges
low_findings.description: Documentation suggests using 'sudo ufw allow 4433/udp' for firewall configuration, which requires system administrator privileges and could be misconfigured.

content.user_title: Master distributed AI databases with advanced vector search
content.value_statement: Build sophisticated multi-agent AI systems with sub-millisecond database synchronization and advanced search capabilities. AgentDB Advanced Features enables distributed vector databases with custom metrics, hybrid search, and QUIC networking for production-scale AI applications.
actual_capabilities: Configure QUIC synchronization for sub-millisecond cross-node communication
Implement custom distance metrics for specialized vector comparisons
Build hybrid search combining vector similarity with metadata filtering
Manage multiple databases with sharding for horizontal scaling
Apply MMR algorithms for diverse search result generation
Synthesize context from multiple memory patterns
limitations: QUIC synchronization needs network configuration and firewall rules
Distributed systems knowledge required for optimal implementation
Performance depends on proper indexing and hardware resources

use_cases.title: Build distributed reasoning systems
use_cases.description: Create multi-agent AI systems that share knowledge across nodes with sub-millisecond synchronization.

use_cases.title: Implement advanced vector search
use_cases.description: Deploy hybrid search systems combining semantic similarity with business metadata for recommendations.

use_cases.title: Scale AI databases horizontally
use_cases.description: Configure database sharding and replication for production AI applications handling millions of vectors.

prompt_templates.title: Basic QUIC Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me configure QUIC synchronization between three AgentDB nodes at IPs 192.168.1.10, 192.168.1.11, and 192.168.1.12 on port 4433.

prompt_templates.title: Hybrid Search
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a hybrid search query for research papers published after 2023 with at least 50 citations in machine learning using cosine similarity.

prompt_templates.title: Custom Distance Metric
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a custom distance metric for product recommendations that weights price similarity at 40% and feature similarity at 60%.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Database Architecture
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a sharding strategy for an e-commerce platform with separate databases for products, users, and orders including routing logic.

output_examples.input: Configure QUIC synchronization for three nodes
output: Enabled TLS 1.3 encryption for all sync traffic
Set sync interval to 1000ms with batch size of 100
Remember to open UDP port 4433 in firewall rules

output_examples.input: Set up hybrid search for products with filters
output: Created hybrid search with vector similarity and metadata filtering
Returned top 50 matching products sorted by combined score

best_practices: Always enable TLS encryption for QUIC synchronization in production environments
Use connection pooling to avoid creating multiple database adapters
Implement proper error handling with exponential backoff for network failures
anti_patterns: Never expose QUIC sync ports to public internet without authentication
Avoid hardcoding IP addresses in production - use service discovery instead
Do not disable MMR when you need diverse results - it prevents echo chambers

faq.question: Is this compatible with all Claude Code versions?
faq.answer: AgentDB Advanced Features works with all Claude Code versions supporting the agentic-flow package and Node.js 18+.

faq.question: What are the performance limits for QUIC synchronization?
faq.answer: QUIC sync supports sub-millisecond latency for up to 1000 patterns per batch with automatic compression and retry.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with existing databases?
faq.answer: AgentDB can import and export data in JSON format and merge with existing SQLite databases using CLI tools.

faq.question: How is my data secured during network synchronization?
faq.answer: QUIC uses TLS 1.3 encryption for all data transmission with firewall rules restricting access to trusted peers.

faq.question: Why am I getting no results from hybrid search?
faq.answer: Try relaxing your metadata filters or increasing the k parameter. Overly restrictive filters eliminate matches.

faq.question: How does this compare to other vector databases?
faq.answer: AgentDB specializes in AI agent memory with reasoning, QUIC sync, and hybrid search for multi-agent systems.
